examples.note: Archaic usage, modern German would be 'des Willens'.

etymology.value: Genitive singular form of German noun 'Wille' (will).

usage_notes.explanation: This is an archaic genitive form of the German word 'Wille' (will). In modern German, the genitive is usually formed using 'des Willens'. 'Willens' is rarely used today, except in fixed expressions or deliberately archaic language.

examples.incorrect: Using 'Willens' instead of 'des Willens' in modern German.

readability_explanation.text: This word is an archaic grammatical form. Understanding requires knowledge of German grammar, specifically the genitive case and its historical forms. It is not commonly encountered in modern German texts.
